div.head: To my well-deserving Friend, Thomas de Gray, upon his exact piece of Horsemanship and Ferriery.
div.l: IF I who love a Horse next to my life,
Should now be mute in the commending strife
Of this thy Horsemanship, my de la Gray,
I might henceforth be banisht all the play
And sit me downe under this Horse and dye.
Nay, I will write before thy Booke, and fill
The vacant roome of some deserving quill.
And wish in all my sport to be as sore,
As when thou work'st upon a desperate Cure.
